channel.title: Daniel Dia on Daniel Dia's Website
channel.description: Recent content in Daniel Dia on Daniel Dia's Website

item.title: Bridging the Gap: Authoring Comprehensive Documentation for the hax Formal Verification Tool
item.description: Authored an 8-module technical documentation set for the hax formal verification library to lower its barrier to entry. The work was shared and discussed by the project’s core team.

item.title: Member of the Events Subcabinet
item.description: Selected as a member of the Events Subcabinet of the AUB Math Society, contributing to planning and running their current and upcoming events.

item.title: Technical Officer â€” Software Development team
item.description: Selected as the Technical Officer at the Software Development team of the Google Developer Groups Groups (GDG) on Campus @AUB club.

item.title: Project Everest: Building a Provably Secure HTTPS Ecosystem with F*
item.description: A talk at AUB’s ‘The Key Exchange’ on using formal methods and the F* language to build provably secure cryptographic software, focusing on the Project Everest ecosystem.

item.title: A Systems Programmer's Case for Rust
item.description: A technical deep-dive into Rust’s core design principles, comparing its approach to memory safety, concurrency, and tooling against C++, Java, and Haskell.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineering Intern
item.description: Member of the full-stack development team, responsible for the end-to-end development of a new web platform for our client LiveLunger.

item.title: LIFE Scholar
item.description: Selected as a scholar for my CCE degree at AUB, recognized for dedication to academic excellence and alignment with LIFE’s mission and values.

item.title: DynamiXplore: A High-Performance Framework for Dynamical Systems
item.description: A Python-first toolkit with a high-performance Rust core for the advanced simulation and analysis of complex dynamical systems, including nonsmooth and chaotic phenomena.

item.title: Online Coursework
item.description: Independent online coursework completed during my undergraduate studies at AUB.

item.title: Undergraduate Coursework at AUB
item.description: All of my undergraduate coursework at AUB.

item.title: Book Recommendations
item.description: A curated list of interesting textbooks and resources for aspiring mathematicians and STEM professionals.

item.title: 'Is mathematics discovered or invented?' â€“ My thoughts on the topic
item.description: Is mathematics invented or discovered? Delve into the philosophy of math vs. science, exploring axioms, inductivism, and the ongoing debate over the nature of mathematical truth.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hello! I’m Daniel Dia ðŸ‘‹

Welcome to my personal corner of the web.

I’m a first-year Computer & Communications Engineering (CCE) and Mathematics dual degree student at the American University of Beirut (AUB).

My passion lies at the intersection of mathematics, cryptography, and systems programming. I’m driven to create software that is not just functional, but also verifiably correct, efficient, and secure.

As an energetic and highly motivated person, my central goal is to democratize access to high-quality technical knowledge and help others explore the “why” behind everything. I’m driven by a profound sense of initiative, whether that’s tutoring, developing open-source tools, or designing hands-on workshops. I thrive on demystifying complex subjects and making them accessible to a wider audience.

item.title: Get In Touch
item.description:
For any particular requests, collaborations, or just to say hi, you can reach me (or see my work for that matter) through the following channels:

  • Email: dmd13@mail.aub.edu
  • My LinkedIn Profile!
  • My BlueSky Profile!
  • My GitHub Profile!
  • My ORCiD ID!
  • Download my resume/CV! (in PDF format)

item.title: Wikipedia Contributor (Volunteer)
item.description: Drove over 1.2 million reader views on edited articles through 150+ enhancements, earning 70+ commendations (’thanks’) from the editorial community.
